item.text: Elijah the Tishbite, from Tishbe in Gilead, said to Ahab, “As certainly as the Lord God of Israel lives (whom I serve), there will be no dew or rain in the years ahead unless I give the command.”
The Lord’s message came to him:

“<st data-num="01980" class="">Leave</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">here</st> and <st data-num="06437" class="">travel</st> <st data-num="06924" class="">eastward</st>. <st data-num="05641" class="">Hide out</st> in the <st data-num="03747" class="">Kerith</st> <st data-num="05158" class="">Valley</st> <st data-num="0834 05921 06440">near</st> the <st data-num="03383" class="">Jordan</st>.

<st data-num="01961 08354">Drink</st> from the <st data-num="05158" class="">stream</st>; I have already <st data-num="06680" class="">told</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="06158" class="">ravens</st> to <st data-num="03557" class="">bring</st> you <st data-num="03557" class="">food</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>.”
So he carried out the Lord’s message; he went and lived in the Kerith Valley near the Jordan.
The ravens would bring him bread and meat each morning and evening, and he would drink from the stream.
After a while, the stream dried up because there had been no rain in the land.
The Lord’s message came to him,

“<st data-num="06965" class="">Get up</st>, <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> to <st data-num="06886 0834">Zarephath</st> in <st data-num="06721" class="">Sidonian</st> territory, and <st data-num="03427" class="">live</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>. I have <st data-num="02009" class="">already</st> <st data-num="06680" class="">told</st><n id="1" /> a <st data-num="0802 0490">widow</st> who lives <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> to <st data-num="03557" class="">provide for</st> you.”

So he <st data-num="06965" class="">got up</st> and <st data-num="0935" class="">went</st> to <st data-num="06886" class="">Zarephath</st>. When he <st data-num="0935" class="">went</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">through</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> <st data-num="06607" class="">gate</st>, <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> was a <st data-num="0802 0490">widow</st> <st data-num="07197" class="">gathering</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st>. He <st data-num="07121 0559">called out</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her, “<st data-num="04994" class="">Please</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">give</st> me a <st data-num="04592" class="">little</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> in a <st data-num="03627" class="">cup</st>, so I can take a <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st>.”

As she <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> to <st data-num="03947" class="">get</st> it, he <st data-num="07121 0559">called out</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her, “<st data-num="04994" class="">Please</st> <st data-num="03947 03027">bring</st> me a <st data-num="06595" class="">piece</st> of <st data-num="03899" class="">bread</st>.”<n id="1" />

She said, “As certainly as the Lord your God lives, I have no food, except for a handful of flour in a jar and a little olive oil in a jug. Right now I am gathering a couple of sticks for a fire. Then I’m going home to make one final meal for my son and myself. After we have eaten that, we will die of starvation.”

<st data-num="0452" class="">Elijah</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her, “<st data-num="0408" class="">Don’t</st> <st data-num="03372" class="">be afraid</st>. <st data-num="0935" class="">Go</st> and <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> as you <st data-num="01697" class="">planned</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0389" class="">But</st> <st data-num="07223" class="">first</st> <st data-num="06213 08033">make</st> me a <st data-num="06996" class="">small</st> <st data-num="05692" class="">cake</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="03318" class="">bring</st> it to me; <st data-num="0314" class="">then</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">make</st> something for yourself and your <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>.
For this is what the Lord God of Israel has said: ‘The jar of flour will not be empty and the jug of oil will not run out until the day the Lord makes it rain on the surface of the ground.’”

She <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> and <st data-num="06213" class="">did</st> as <st data-num="0452" class="">Elijah</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">told</st> her; there <st data-num="0398" class="">was</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">always</st> enough <st data-num="0398" class="">food</st> for <st data-num="01931" class="">Elijah</st> and for <st data-num="01931" class="">her</st> and her <st data-num="01004" class="">family</st>.<n id="1" />
The jar of flour was never empty and the jug of oil never ran out, in keeping with the Lord’s message that he had spoken through Elijah.
After this the son of the woman who owned the house got sick. His illness was so severe he could no longer breathe.

She <st data-num="0559 0413">asked</st> <st data-num="0452" class="">Elijah</st>, “<st data-num="04100" class="">Why</st>, <st data-num="0376 0430">prophet</st>, have you <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me to <st data-num="02142" class="">confront</st> me <st data-num="02142" class="">with</st><n id="2" /> my <st data-num="05771" class="">sin</st> and <st data-num="04191" class="">kill</st> my <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>?”

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her, “<st data-num="05414" class="">Hand</st> me your <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>.” He <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> him from her <st data-num="02436" class="">arms</st>, <st data-num="05927" class="">carried</st> him <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="05944" class="">upper room</st> <st data-num="0834 08033">where</st> <st data-num="01931" class="">he</st> was <st data-num="03427" class="">staying</st>, and <st data-num="07901" class="">laid</st> him <st data-num="07901" class="">down</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his <st data-num="04296" class="">bed</st>.
Then he called out to the Lord, “O Lord, my God, are you also bringing disaster on this widow I am staying with by killing her son?”
He stretched out over the boy three times and called out to the Lord, “O Lord, my God, please let this boy’s breath return to him.”
The Lord answered Elijah’s prayer; the boy’s breath returned to him and he lived.

<st data-num="0452" class="">Elijah</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> the <st data-num="03206" class="">boy</st>, <st data-num="03381" class="">brought</st> him <st data-num="03381" class="">down</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="05944" class="">upper room</st> to the <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st>, and <st data-num="05414" class="">handed</st> him to his <st data-num="0517" class="">mother</st>. <st data-num="0452" class="">Elijah</st> then <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="07200" class="">See</st>, your <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> is <st data-num="02416" class="">alive</st>!”
The woman said to Elijah, “Now I know that you are a prophet and that the Lord’s message really does come through you.”
